subject: Communication
title: Power Poses: Myth or Science?
description: A 60-second lesson on Power Poses: Myth or Science?.

hook.text: Amy Cuddy's TED talk said standing like Wonder Woman for two minutes boosts confidence. 70 million views.

buildup.text: Her 2010 study claimed power poses raise testosterone and lower cortisol, changing your hormones.

discovery.text: Replication studies failed to confirm the hormonal changes. The scientific community pushed back hard.

twist.text: But later research found power poses do affect feelings of confidence â€” even if hormones don't change.

climax.text: The lesson: posture influences self-perception (embodied cognition), even if the original claims were too bold.

punchline.text: Power poses may not change your chemistry. They might change your mind.

quiz.question: What happened when power pose research was replicated?
options: Hormonal changes weren't confirmed, but confidence effects were
